 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַתוּן‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Dan.3.19|Dan 3:19]]</sup> (probably **feminine**<sup>v[[Dan.3.26|Dan 3:26]]</sup>) ==furnace== (probably loan-word from Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***utûnu, atûnu***</u></abbr>, ***id.***, [also Tel Amarna], [[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>VOJ 1.23</sup> [[BDB#Buhl|Buhl]]; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> hence Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> as loan-word [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>26</sup>; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>763</sup>; conjectures on etymology in [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 59 Anm.</sup> [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 111</sup>); — construct <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎א‎</span> [[Dan.3.6|Dan 3:6]]; [[Dan.3.11|Dan 3:11]]; [[Dan.3.15|Dan 3:15]]; [[Dan.3.17|Dan 3:17]]; [[Dan.3.20|Dan 3:20]]; [[Dan.3.21|Dan 3:21]]; [[Dan.3.23|Dan 3:23]]; [[Dan.3.26|Dan 3:26]] emphatic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַתוּנָא‎</span> [[Dan.3.19|Dan 3:19]]; [[Dan.3.22|Dan 3:22]]. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִתַי‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִיתַי‎</span>.
